author: Reuters
description: Facebook said it discovered a bug in its video carousel ad system.
title: Facebook to Reimburse Some Advertisers After Overcharging

author: Contributor
description: The government of Thailand has backed down on a threat to ban Facebook if it did not block content deemed to be illegal in the country. The ruling military..
title: Thailand backs down on threat to ban Facebook

author: Mike Shields
description: The big TV networks are using their 'upfront' ad sales presentations to point out Facebook and Google's recent advertising mishaps
title: TV networks are kicking Facebook and Google while they are down

author: Reuters Editorial
description: Facebook (FB.O) has been fined 150,000 euros ($166,000) by France's data protection watchdog for failing to prevent its users' data being accessed by advertisers.
title: Facebook fined 150,000 euros by French data watchdog

author: http://www.abc.net.au/news/paul-crossley/7901826
description: Facebook says its mission is to give people the power to share but what happens when its users choose to share a murder live online?
title: When Facebook livestreams a murder, who's responsible?

author: Mathew Ingram
description: Some sites say traffic to their posts skyrocketed after Facebook applied a warning flag about disputed facts.
title: Facebook’s Fact Checking Can Make Fake News Spread Even Faster

author: Oliver Holmes
description: Facebook still available in country despite being given Tuesday deadline to remove content deemed insulting to monarchy
title: Thai authorities appear to back down on threat to block Facebook

author: Angela Moon and Aishwarya Venugopal
description: Facebook Inc's (FB.O) Instagram has souped up its camera with quirky face-tracking filters, adding another feature similar to one offered by social media rival Snap Inc's (SNAP.N) Snapchat.
title: Facebook adds Snapchat-like camera filters to Instagram

author: Rachel Kaser
description:
Facebook has been fined €150,000 by a European data protection watchdog for not protecting private information from advertisers.

The investigation, conducted by the Commission ...
title: France fines Facebook 0.002% of revenue for breaking privacy law

author: Charlie Nash
description: Facebook is appealing an order to impose Austria's social media laws against hate speech on the platform worldwide.
title: Facebook to Appeal Court Ruling Imposing Austria's 'Hate Speech' Ban Globally - Breitbart
